org.jslipc.ipc.pipe.file

Class ChunkFilePipe

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jslipc.ipc.pipe.file.ChunkFilePipe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, JslipcBinman, JslipcPipe

    public class ChunkFilePipe
extends Object
implements JslipcPipe, JslipcBinman
    In contrast to the FilePipe this implementation is based on chunk files which are written to a directory by a WritableChunkFileChannel and consumed by a ReadableChunkFileChannel. Once consumed, a chunk is immediately deleted from disk, so only yet unread data needs to be persisted. This way, the ChunkFilePipe does not block like the SharedMemoryPipe and does not waste disk space like the FilePipe. The price is speed, since creating vast of files costs time.

    You may either provide both directories or a directory and the role of this end of the pipe. This implementation provides a JslipcBinman.cleanUpOnClose() method, which will delete the files on close().

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChunkFilePipe

        public ChunkFilePipe(File directory,
             JslipcRole role)
              throws IOException
        This is an alternative to ChunkFilePipe(File, File) where you do not pass the two files, but a directory hosting two files yangToYin and yinToYang. The files are created if they do not yet exist. Which one is used for source or sink depends on the role:
        role source sink
        yang yinToYang yangToYin
        yin yangToYin yinToYang
        The role itself does not have any special semantics, means: it makes no difference whether you are yin or yang. It is just needed to distinguish the endpoints of the pipe, so one end should have the role yin, the other yang.
        Parameters:
        directory -
        role -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • ChunkFilePipe

        public ChunkFilePipe(File sourceDir,
             File sinkDir)
        Creates a pipe with a ReadableChunkFileChannel and WritableChunkFileChannel based on the given directories.
        Parameters:
        sourceDir - the directory to create the ReadableChunkFileChannel from.
        sinkDir - the directory to create the WritableChunkFileChannel from.
